data.event: The original plat of the town of Elizabeth was recorded on April 17, 1812.

event.title: organized by the town on December 29, 1959

data.event: The town fire department was first organized by the town on December 29, 1959.
It was a 1941 International Fire Truck, purchased for $200.
Around 1890 seminary education first became available at Clay Hill College in downtown Elizabeth.
The College was later moved and the high school eventually took over that building around 1908.
The first graduation was held on April 13, 1912.
The high school burned down in 1935.
In 1936 Posey Township completed construction of a new brick school building.
The building is still in use today, owned and operated by a local civic non-profit organization.
The town's school children now attend South Central High School, which serves the entire south-eastern portion of Harrison County.
